bayou.html

Interface HtmlBuilder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Html4, Html5
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Html4Doc, Html5Doc

    public interface HtmlBuilder
    Supertype of html builders.

    An html builder interface/class (e.g. Html4) contains piece types (e.g. Html4.DIV) and builder methods (e.g. Html4._div()). Application code usually accesses them through inheritance, for example, 

         class MyDoc extends Html4Doc//which implements Html4
     {{
         _body( ()->
         {
             DIV div = _div();
         });
     }}

    A piece type (e.g. Html4.DIV) describes a specific type of html pieces. It contains state changing methods (e.g. to add attributes/children).

    A builder method (e.g. Html4._div()) creates a piece and add it to the context parent. A builder method should be an instance method. Its name should start with an underscore (to visually distinguish it from "normal" methods).

    This interface (HtmlBuilder) contains the class ContextParent, and some basic builder methods like _text(Object...).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class HtmlBuilder.ContextParent
      A utility class dealing with context parents.

    • Method Summary

      Default Methods
      HtmlText _text(Object... args)
      Add textual content.
      HtmlText _textf(String format, Object... args)
      Add formatted textual content.
      HtmlComment _comment(Object... args)
      Add an html comment.
      HtmlRaw _raw(Object... args)
      Add raw content.
      HtmlNewLine _newline()
      Add a new line ("\n").

    • Method Detail

      • _text

        default HtmlText _text(Object... args)
        Add textual content.

        This method is equivalent to `ContextParent.add(new HtmlText(args))`.

        Example: 

             _text("there are ", 5, " apples.");

      • _textf

        default HtmlText _textf(String format,
                        Object... args)
        Add formatted textual content.

        This method is equivalent to `_text( String.format(format, args) )`. See String.format(format, args).

        Example: 

             _textf("there are %d apples.", 5);

      • _comment

        default HtmlComment _comment(Object... args)
        Add an html comment.

        This method is equivalent to `ContextParent.add(new HtmlComment(args))`.

        Example: 

             _comment("begin article #", 5);
     //   <!-- begin article #5 -->

      • _raw

        default HtmlRaw _raw(Object... args)
        Add raw content.

        This method is equivalent to `ContextParent.add(new HtmlRaw(args))`.

        Example: 

             _raw("<span>abc</span>");

        Raw content is dangerous, since no escaping is done. If it contains strings from end user inputs, make sure they are sanitized or escaped first.

      • _newline

        default HtmlNewLine _newline()
        Add a new line ("\n").

        This method is equivalent to `ContextParent.add(HtmlNewLine.instance)`.

        A new line can be inserted between two inline elements for formatting purpose (if it's ok to insert spaces between them). For example 

                 _div( _input(), _newline(), _input() )
         //    <div>
         //        <input>
         //        <input>
         //    </div>

        Note that a new line corresponds to a "\n", not a "<br>".

        This method is usually not needed before/after a block element.
